messages.message:
@Nikolaos Kofinas from earlier in the thread, it sounds like Sean is proposing (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1727114765618359?thread_ts=1727109466.472769&cid=C06FA6A23) that we dynamically change mypy just for webserver and model-service (btw just confirming it is webserver that imports ibllm?). I think he was waiting on your PR to upgrade mypy in one of the services? I would recommend model-service as a starting point, since we are more familiar with that one. How did the update go? model-service pulls in quite a few shared modules, so I'm wondering if that causes a lot of mypy errors.

@sean.donohoe is it possible to use different mypy versions for model-service and ibllm (a module imported into model-service)? I'm guessing not?

When I look at the model-service requirements.txt, I don't see mypy inside - does this mean we have a different env where we run mypy checks? I'm wondering what python env we use to run unit tests / mypy checks, to better understand how much code would need to be updated to mypy 1+
that is my confusion as well because IBllm has a dependency on mypy in the requirements.txt
Hey there -- just getting caught up on this now, apologies for the delay, have been preoccupied with code cut items
